name.fallback: Chapter 7: The Legacy of the Gods

pages.fallback: The first war has just ended. I watched nine humans cause the death of millions of simulated beings for their entertainment.
The winner, a man named Marcus who embodied Odin, seemed troubled by his experience. His wish reduced the destruction of future wars - perhaps he had perceived the truth?
During our brief meeting after his wish, I saw in his eyes the reflection of my own horror. 'It wasn't supposed to be so... real,' he confided in me.
I revealed part of the truth to him, limited by the time I was granted. Marcus swore to pass on what he had learned.
He hid his writings in Asgard, establishing a tradition that each new Odin will perpetuate.
Even more remarkably, he convinced several other players to share their discoveries with their successors.
Thus was born the system of divine legacies - a chain of knowledge passed from one war to another, an act of silent rebellion.
The nine realms continue to evolve between wars, and with them, grows the hope that one day, a god will understand enough to formulate the perfect wish.
